title: [Kung Fu] The Lady Hermit - Shaw Brothers Celestial Remastered D

Director: Hoh Mung Wa (Ho Meng-Hua)
Choreography: Leung Siu Chung (Liang Shao Sung)
Released: 1971 [Hong Kong]
Genre: Martial Arts
    Sub-Genre: Action/Adventure
Collections:  Celestial Shaw Bros. Series

Plot:	Cheng Pei-Pei plays master swordswoman Chung Kuei, who is injured in her chivalrous attempts to reform the villainous Black Demon. Hell has no fury like a woman wounded, so she teams with a pretty young sword student and virtuous swordsman for revenge.

Overview:	Shaw Studios knew a good thing when they teamed their remarkable star Cheng Pei-Pei with versatile director Ho Meng-Hua. Their collaboration is always considered the best that can be done. Cheng plays master swordswoman Chung Kuei, who is injured in her chivalrous attempts to reform the villainous Black Demon. Hell has no fury like a woman wounded, so she teams with a pretty young sword student and virtuous swordsman to take revenge. In addition to this exciting story, the director and his star made it magic.

Cast: 	Cheng Pei Pei  ||  Lo Lieh  ||  Si Si (Shih Szu)  ||  Wong Hap (Wang Hsia)  ||  Chiu Hung  ||  Chuen Yuen  ||  Fong Min  ||  Cliff Lok  ||  Suen Lam  ||  Kok Lee Yan  ||  Nam Wai Lit  ||  Tong Tin Hei  ||  Lee Siu Chung  ||  Law Hon  ||  Gam Gwan  ||  Chow Kong  ||  Yuen Shun-Yi  ||  Yuen Cheung Yan  ||  Yeung Chak Lam

Running Time:	93 mins. (approx.)

Languages:	Mandarin (Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround)
